data.text:
As for "The Wolfman", I'm leaning towards Edgar Wright. He could be good for "The Invisible Man", but hopefully not as many difficulties like he had with Universal.

I'm not sure if I would put James Gunn in there. It depends if he can clean up his personal life, but that's me.

But I do recall Mr. Blum saying he wanted to do a musical. He was thinking moreso like one from the golden age, but why not make it an original musical or jukebox? My choices for Erik and Christina do know how, and she HAS been in a musical for Universal... https://t.co/7D19FAdsA9

And yes, I would put Noah Segan as the heroic Prodigium agent/romantic lead and JGL in a cameo as an opera performer. :)

(My God, look how young Noah is here...) https://t.co/ClpRPv8MaB
And I've said numerous times Rian Johnson should direct the "Phantom" installment. He half-jokingly said it while discussing ALW musicals, but why wouldn't it work?
But the story doesn't quite end there, as Matthew Van Helsing (another reincarnation of Archangel Gabriel) has been tasked with bringing him to the monster unit in the present.

But I also think Patty Jenkins would do so well with that one. I envision it being like "Highlander" where he has flashbacks to an important time in his life (It would be 1931 when he came to London and met Mina, who brings out his long thought gone humanity.) https://t.co/1pxru4DDU7
